item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: The Chicago White Sox acquire Jake Peavy in a 4-for-1 deal
item.description: The Chicago White Sox acquire Jake Peavy in a 4-for-1 deal.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: MLB trade deadline: Boston Red Sox's pursuit of Victor Martinez of Cleveland Indians heats up
item.description: The Boston Red Sox have agreed to a deal to acquire All-Star slugger Victor Martinez from the Cleveland Indians.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: MLB Trade: Jarrod Washburn of the Seattle Mariners traded to the Detroit Tigers
item.description: The Seattle Mariners have traded left-handed pitcher Jarrod Washburn to the Detroit Tigers for rookie left-hander Luke French and a minor league pitcher, sources tell ESPN.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Brazilian police: Arturo Gatti hung himself from staircase more than seven feet off ground
item.description: Boxer Arturo Gatti's body has been exhumed, and the Quebec coroner's office will perform a new autopsy at his family's request.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Hawaii Warriors coach Greg McMackin suspended 30 days for gay slur against Notre Dame Fighting Irish
item.description: Hawaii coach Greg McMackin is being suspended for 30 days and voluntarily taking a pay cut for making a derogatory comment while describing Notre Dame's chant before last year's Hawaii Bowl.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Indiana Pacers' Tyler Hansbrough faces 2-month layoff with shin injury
item.description: Tyler Hansbrough could miss up to two months with a right shin injury, but the Indiana Pacers believe their first-round draft pick will be healthy enough for the start of the season.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady says recontructed knee OK, arm getting there
item.description: Patriots quarterback Tom Brady expects to play in exhibition games next month -- his first action since injuring his knee in the 2008 regular season opener.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Bronson Arroyo says he used andro, stopped due to rumors it was tainted with steroids
item.description: Bronson Arroyo said he would not be surprised to find his name on a list of 104 ballplayers who tested positive for performance-enhancing drugs in 2003, thanks to rumors a then-legal supplement he was using at the time was tainted with steroids.

item.dc:creator: Scott Burnside
item.title: Sources: NHL investigates Marion Hossa, Chris Pronger contracts
item.description: The NHL is investigating Marian Hossa's 12-year, $62.8 million contract with the Chicago Blackhawks.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: PGA Tour: Tiger Woods rebounds with 63 at Buick Open
item.description: Tiger Woods has shot a season-low, second-round 63 to move into contention at the Buick Open.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: MLB Trade: Orlando Cabrera traded to Minnesota Twins
item.description: Shortstop Orlando Cabrera has been traded from the Oakland Athletics to the Minnesota Twins.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Training Camp: Leon Washington of New York Jets shows at training camp
item.description: New York Jets running back Leon Washington has reported to the team and was on the field for the first practice of training camp.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: New York Giants linebacker Antonio Pierce appears again in front of grand jury in Plaxico Burress case
item.description: Giants linebacker Antonio Pierce has finished two days of testimony before before the grand jury investigating a gun charge against former teammate Plaxico Burress.

item.dc:creator: J.A. Adande and Marc Stein
item.title: Lamar Odom will return to the Los Angeles Lakers
item.description: Lamar Odom will return to the Los Angeles Lakers, according to an NBA source.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Report: Manny Ramirez, David Ortiz tested positive for performance-enhancing drugs in 2003
item.description: Manny Ramirez and David Ortiz tested positive for performance-enhancing drugs in 2003, lawyers with knowledge of the results told The New York Times.
